module.name: CalcForm
module.short: Contains classes and types used in TCalculatorForm.

descr.p: calcform.pas contains classes and types used in TCalculatorForm, a dialog form used to display a calculator. It is part of the Lazarus Component Library (LCL).

element.name: CalcDefPrecision
element.short: Defines the default number of digits of precision used for values in TCalculatorForm.

element.name: TCalculatorCalcKeyEvent
element.short: Specifies an event handler signalled for Key events occurring in TCalculatorForm.

element.name: TCalculatorCalcKeyEvent.Key
element.short: Key value examined in the event handler.

element.name: TCalculatorDispChangeEvent
element.short: Specifies an event handler signalled when the display in TCalculatorForm is changed.

element.name: TCalculatorState
element.short: Represents status values used in TCalculatorPanel.

descr.p: TCalculatorState is an enumerated type with values that represent the status for keys/operations in the calculator. TCalculatorState is the type used to implement the Status property in TCalculatorPanel.

element.name: TCalculatorState.csFirst
element.short: Value when an initial key press or button click has not yet been detected and applied to a calculator panel.

element.name: TCalculatorState.csValid
element.short: Value after an operation for a key press or mouse click has been successfully applied.

element.name: TCalculatorState.csError
element.short: Value when an operation results in an error condition for a calculator panel.

element.name: TCalculatorLayout
element.short: Represents layouts used for panels on a TCalculatorForm instance.

descr.p: TCalculatorLayout is an enumerated type with values that represent the layout for keys and panels on a calculator form. TCalculatorLayout is passed as an argument to the CreateCalculatorForm routine, and to methods in TCalculatorForm and TCalculatorPanel.

element.name: TCalculatorLayout.clNormal
element.short: The default layout with larger button sizes, more whitespace, and buttons for common calculator operations like Back, Clear, Ok and Cancel.

element.name: TCalculatorLayout.clSimple
element.short: The compact layout with smaller buttons using equally sized sizes. Some buttons like Back, Clear, Ok and Cancel are omitted in the simple layout.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel
element.short: Implements a panel used for buttons and the value display in a calculator form.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.SetCalcText
element.short: Sets the value for the text property.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.SetCalcText.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.CheckFirst
element.short: Ensures that Text is updated and displayed when Status is csFirst.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.CalcKey
element.short: Performs actions for a key press notification in the calculator panel.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.CalcKey.Key
element.short: Character value for the key pressed.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.Clear
element.short: Clears the display and operator in the calculator panel.

descr.p: Called when the Clear button on the panel is clicked, or when the 'C' key is pressed. Sets the display text to '0/0' and causes the OnDisplayChange event handler to be notified. Resets the OperatorChar property to '='.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.Error
element.short: Updates the calculator panel to reflect an error condition and signals the OnError event handler.

descr.p: Changes the text displayed on the panel to the value in the rsError resource string and updates the Status property to csError. Calls ErrorBeep to produce an error beep when enabled in BeepOnError. Signals the OnError event handler (when assigned).

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.SetDisplay
element.short: Sets the Text in the calculator panel to the specified value, and signals OnDisplayChange.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.SetDisplay.R
element.short: Double value formatted and assigned to the Text property.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.GetDisplay
element.short: Gets the Double value represented in the Text property.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.GetDisplay.Result
element.short: Textual representation for DisplayValue using the Precision for the panel.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.FindButton
element.short: Finds the calculator button which handles the specified key character.

descr.p: Key contains a character value to locate in the button captions on the panel. Keys which are not represented by buttons, like Enter (#13) and Escape (#27), are translated to the value used for the target button. In addition, when ',' is used as the decimal separator on the system, it is translated into the '.' decimal notation.
FindButton iterates through the Controls on the panel to locate the button using the associated Key. The return value is Nil when a button is not located for the value in Key.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.FindButton.Result
element.short: Button which handles the Key, or Nil when no button is available for Key.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.FindButton.Key
element.short: Key character to locate in the buttons for the calculator panel.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.BtnClick
element.short: Translates a mouse click on a button to the character key used in CalcKey.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.BtnClick.Sender
element.short: Calculator button for the button click notification.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.ErrorBeep
element.short: Produces an error tone when enabled using the BeepOnError property.

descr.p: ErrorBeep has an empty implementation in the current LCL version. No error tone is produced.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.TextChange
element.short: Sets the display text for the calculator panel and signals OnTextChange.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.CreateLayout
element.short: Initializes and configures the calculator panel using the specified layout.

descr.p: CreateLayout is a constructor for the class instance. It calls the inherited Create constructor on entry, and sets the default values for properties.
AOwner is the component which owns the class instance (the TCalculatorForm instance).
ALayout specifies both the position and size for the buttons on the panel. It affects the Width and Height for the panel as well.

CreateLayout creates the calculator buttons and positions them on the panel for the specified layout. When clNormal is used in ALayout, buttons are created for Back, Clear, Ok and Cancel. clNormal also causes a panel used for Memory display to be created and positioned.
CreateLayout is called from the InitForm method in TCalculatorForm.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.CreateLayout.AOwner
element.short: Component which owns the class instance.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.CreateLayout.ALayout
element.short: Layout applied to the panel and its buttons.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.CalcKeyPress
element.short: Applies a key or button press to the calculator panel.

descr.p: CalcKeyPress is a method used to implement the OnKeyPress event handler for the TCalculatorForm instance where the panel is displayed.
Sender is the object instance (TCalculatorForm) for the event notification.

Key is the character value for the key (or button) for the notification. If Key is the caption for one of the buttons on the panel, its Click method is called. Otherwise, the private CalcKey method is called to apply the Key value.
CalcKeyPress is called by a TCalculatorForm instance when its OnKeyPress event handler is executed.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.CalcKeyPress.Sender
element.short: Object for the KeyPress event.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.CalcKeyPress.Key
element.short: Key value captured in the panel.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.Copy
element.short: Loads the value in Text into the Clipboard as plain text.

descr.p: Called when the Copy context menu item for a TCalculatorForm instance is clicked.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.Paste
element.short: Pastes text from the Clipboard into the text display for the calculator panel.

descr.p: Called when the Paste context menu item for a TCalculatorForm instance is clicked.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.WorkingPrecision
element.short: Gets the minimum number of precision digits allowed for the DisplayValue on the panel.

descr.p: WorkingPrecision is an Integer function used to get the number of decimal digits used to format the DisplayValue on the panel. The minimum precision used for the floating point value is 2, but can be increased by setting the value for the Precision property.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.WorkingPrecision.Result
element.short: Number of decimal digits displayed for the floating point DisplayValue.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.UpdateMemoryLabel
element.short: Updates the Memory indicator to reflect a non-zero value present in the Memory property.

descr.p: Causes the character 'M' to be displayed when Memory has a non-zero value. Otherwise, the Memory indicator is cleared.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.DisplayValue
element.short: Contains the Double value representing the result (and Text) displayed on the calculator panel.

descr.p: DisplayValue is a Double property which contains the result for a value entered or calculated using the calculator panel. The property value is determined by calling StrToDouble to convert the value in Text to a floating point value. The property value is 0.0 if Status contains csError.

Changing the value for the property causes Text to be updated. The Double value is formatted using the Precision needed for the panel, and the OnDisplayChange event handler is signalled (when assigned).

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.Memory
element.short: Contains the Double value stored as the memory for the calculator panel.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.Precision
element.short: Number of digits used after the decimal for the Double value in the calculator panel.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.BeepOnError
element.short: Indicates whether a beep occurs when an error condition is detected in the calculator panel.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.Status
element.short: Contains the status or state for the calculator panel.

descr.p: Status is a TCalculatorState property which indicate the state for the calculator panel. Values from the TCalculatorState enumeration are applied to the property when the panel is updated for key presses or mouse clicks.
csError indicates an error condition was detected, and causes 0.0 to be returned in the DisplayValue for the panel.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.OperatorChar
element.short: Character representing the last operator entered using the calculator panel.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.Text
element.short: Text representation for the Double display value on the calculator panel.

descr.p: Text is a read-only String property in TCalculatorPanel with the textual representation for the DisplayValue on the panel. It contains the text formatted using the Precision needed for the DisplayValue. Text is updated when a new value is assigned to DisplayValue, when CalcKeyPress is executed for the panel, or when methods for Error or Clear buttons are called.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.OnOkClick
element.short: Event handler signalled when the OK button on the calculator panel has been clicked.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.OnCancelClick
element.short: Event handler signalled when the Cancel button on the calculator form has been clicked, or the form is closed using the Close window decoration or an accelerator key.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.OnResultClick
element.short: Event handler signalled when the Enter key, = or % operators are clicked on the panel.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.OnError
element.short: Event handler signalled when the Error method is called for the calculator panel.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.OnTextChange
element.short: Event handler signalled when a new value has been assigned to the Text for the panel.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.OnCalcKey
element.short: Event handler signalled when a key press is applied to the calculator panel.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.OnDisplayChange
element.short: Event handler signalled following a change to the DisplayValue for the calculator panel.

element.name: TCalculatorPanel.Color
element.short: Background color for the calculator panel.

descr.p: Color is a TColor property with the background color used for the calculator panel. It is redefined in TCalculatorPanel to use clBtnFace as the default value for the property. Please note to ParentColor is ultimately set to True for the panels on a TCalculatorForm instance.

element.name: TCalculatorForm
element.short: Implements the form used to display a calculator for a TCalculatorDialog instance.

descr.p: TCalculatorForm is a TForm descendant which implements the form used to display a calculator. It extends the ancestor class with properties, methods, and events needed to configure and display the form instance with UI elements needed for either a simple (compact) or a normal calculator layout. Use the Create constructor to control the layout for the calculator form instance.
Use the Value property to set or get the value displayed on the calculator.
Use the OnCalcKey and OnDisplayChange event handlers to perform actions needed when keys are pressed or the display value is changed on the form instance.

element.name: TCalculatorForm.FormKeyPress.Sender
element.short: Object for the event notification.

element.name: TCalculatorForm.FormKeyPress.Key

element.name: TCalculatorForm.CopyItemClick

element.name: TCalculatorForm.PasteItemClick
element.short: Implements a paste menu item in the pop-up menu for the form.

element.name: TCalculatorForm.PasteItemClick.Sender
element.short: Object instance for the click notification.

element.short: Sets the value for the Value property.

element.name: TCalculatorForm.SetValue.AValue

element.name: TCalculatorForm.OkClick

element.name: TCalculatorForm.CancelClick

element.name: TCalculatorForm.CalcKey

element.name: TCalculatorForm.CalcKey.Key
element.short: Key examined in the method.

element.name: TCalculatorForm.DisplayChange
element.short: Performs actions needed when the calculator display is changed.

element.name: TCalculatorForm.DisplayChange.Sender

element.name: TCalculatorForm.Value

element.name: TCalculatorForm.MainPanel
element.short: TPanel instance used as a container for the display and button panels on the calculator form.

element.name: TCalculatorForm.CalcPanel
element.short: Panel with the calculator keys, operators,memory buttons, et. al.

element.name: TCalculatorForm.DisplayPanel
element.short: Panel for the display area on the calculator form.

element.name: TCalculatorForm.DisplayLabel
element.short: Label used to display the value in the panel.

element.name: TCalculatorForm.OnCalcKey
element.short: Event handler signalled to handle keys press on the calculator form.

element.name: TCalculatorForm.OnDisplayChange
element.short: Event handler signalled when the calculator display has been changed.

element.name: CreateCalculatorForm
element.short: Creates, configures, and returns a new TCalculatorForm instance.

descr.p: CreateCalculatorForm is a TCalculatorForm function used to create and configure a new calculator form instance using the arguments passed to the routine.

ALayout determines the number, type, position, and size for buttons on the calculator form. It is passed as argument to the TCalculatorForm.Create constructor used to instantiate the return value. See TCalculatorLayout for more information on the layout values.
AHelpContext contains the help context identifier assigned to the HelpContext property in the form instance.

CreateCalculatorForm ensures that the form instance is scaled to the PPI setting for the Screen, and updates Left and Top to center the form on the Screen display area. If an exception occurs during this operation the form instance is freed, and the return value is Nil. The exception is re-raised to perform exception handling enabled in the application.
CreateCalculatorForm is called from methods in TCalcEdit and TCalculatorDialog when the form instance is created for the controls.

element.name: CreateCalculatorForm.Result
element.short: Form instance created in the method.

element.name: CreateCalculatorForm.AOwner
element.short: Owner for the new form instance.

element.name: CreateCalculatorForm.ALayout
element.short: Layout for the calculator panel in the form instance.

element.name: CreateCalculatorForm.AHelpContext
element.short: Help context for the newly created form instance in the return value.
